Our Young 5's learners are transitioning into their new school routines beautifully!
.
These are 4 and barely 5 year olds doing independent work cycles, learning how to set up and use their Montessori works, and put them away when they are done!
.
Maria Montessori was a genius in how she taught the teachers to be guides versus the star of the show. The Guide (teacher) shows the children exactly how to do the work in a group, and then the children are in charge of their learning, choosing the works they want to do, making for a life long love of learning!
.

One of the most beautiful things about the Montessori multi-age classroom concept is how the older children in the classroom get to mentor the younger children. üëç

This has benefits for both the mentor and the mentee. Concepts are always solidified into long term memory easier when you have a chance to teach them, making the recall of these concepts fast and so natural for the mentors. The confidence that the older children in the room have is out of this world! And younger children just plain respond best from their peers! We witness over and over again how learning comes with great ease when working with their mentors! ü§ì
